alert.note: Alert for Hampshire; Middlesex; Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 3:14PM EST until January 14 at 4:00PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northern Worcester County in central Massachusetts... Eastern Hampshire County in western Massachusetts... Northwestern Middlesex County in northeastern Massachusetts... * Until 400 PM EST. * At 313 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Brookline to New Braintree, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Locations impacted include... Worcester, Lowell, Leominster, Fitchburg, Marlborough, Shrewsbury, Chelmsford, Dracut, Westford, Acton, Gardner, Hudson, Sudbury, Holden, Northborough, Clinton, Spencer, Pepperell, Tyngsborough, and Groton. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED
